title: Photos of the President with cake (George W Bush (43) Presidential Library)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: Photos of the President with cake (George W Bush (43) Presidential Library)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

All photographs either taken by White House photographers or otherwise held by the Library which include or feature the president and a cake, birthday or otherwise.

I am journalist who writes extensively about FBI files - https://www.muckrock.com/project/subjects-matter-fbi-files-10/, which have received national and international attention - http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3219376/Undercover-FBI-agents-spy-annual-Burning-Man-festival-light-ongoing-war-terrorism-use-test-new-intelligence-collection-technology.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

JPat Brown

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Request: Photos of the President with cake (George W Bush (43) Presidential Library)
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Brown,

Thank you for contacting the George W. Bush Presidential Library and 
Museum. Please see the attached information regarding your FOIA request.

If I may be of further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Sincerely,
Malisa Culpepper
FOIA Coordinator

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Kristi A. Saylor records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all documents, records, files, photographs, videos, recordings, electronic communications, facsimiles, emails, arrest records, police reports, interagency communications, external agency communications, dispatch logs, audio, visua, dash cams video and audio, surveillance logs or files, 911 records , internal affairs files, complaints, logs, and recordings and any other item indexed to my name,  Kristi Ann Saylor

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristi A. Saylor

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: State of Virginia Salaries 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:


State of Virginia Fiscal Year 2023 Compensation Data for All Employees
Please provide the following fields for each employee in the dataset: 
Employee # | FIrst Name | Middle Name/Initial | Last Name | Employee Role Title | Position Number | Agency Name | Agency Location | Agency Address | Agency City/State/ZIP | Employee Category | Compensation (Base Pay, Salary, Hourly Rate, Total Pay, etc) | Overtime | Benefits Pay | Date Hired | Date Terminated | FT/PT 

Note:  If not all fields listed above are releasable as public record or available please disregard those individual fields for this request.

I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by either e-mail attachment or FTP Download if available, otherwise sent through mail via CD/DVD. I would appreciate the request to be filled in an accessible format, including but not limited to: CSV, Excel, Microsoft Access database, or other bulk list file type.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Tyler King.

communications.subject: Re: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: State of Virginia Salaries 2023
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

This office is in receipt of your request for records made in accordance with the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (§ 2.2-3700 et seq.). Please be advised that it is practically impossible to provide the requested records or determine whether they are available within the five work days required by FOIA. Therefore, we are invoking subsection B 4 of § 2.2-3704 to provide us with an additional seven work days  to respond to your request.

Thank you for contacting this office.
Best,

Mecca Hall

Communications and Public Relations Manager | FOIA Officer

Department of Human Resource Management

101 N 14th Street, 12th Floor

Richmond Virginia 23219

Cell: 804.773.0247

www.dhrm.virginia.gov/<https://www.dhrm.virginia.gov/>

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: State of Virginia Salaries 2023
communications.communication: Good afternoon, I just had a couple questions regarding the data provided. I was curious if this dataset is representative of the 2023 fiscal year (from 7/1/2022 - 6/30/2023) as requested, or if the data provided was an as-of "snapshot" based on the report run date? I ask because it appears there are several employees with "Company Seniority Dates" and "Employees State Begin Dates" beyond the 2023 fiscal year. Can you also clarify which field should be considered the Employee Start Date, and may we also get a list of non-abbreviated "Companies"?

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: State of Virginia Salaries 2023
communications.communication:
Good morning, 

I wanted to follow up on my previous email from 8/30 regarding the effective date of the data provided as well as a list of non-abbreviated "Companies". 

I also wanted to inquire about a record count discrepancy between this data and data previously released by this office in response to a separate request for 2022 employee compensation data. 2022's data had over 110,000 employee records released while this year has about 55,000 employee records. Looking at some specific employees existing in 2022 that do not exist in the 2023 data, it appears that most of those records belong to "Faculty, University Staff, and Political Jurisdiction Staff" with record counts of those classifications having the approximate record count of the difference between the two files. 

Would you be able to clarify the effective date of the data (FY 2023 as requested, or a snapshot in time as of the run of the report), as well as the field that could be considered Employee Start Date? Would it be possible to include these records in the 2023 disclosure as they were provided in response to a separate request for 2022 employee compensation data?  If you could a "key" between the company abbreviation provided and their non-abbreviated descriptions/names, that would also be greatly appreciated. 

Best,
Tyler

title: Lake Jackson Texas Police - Arrest of Rolando Reyes by Officer Johnny Cagle and Officer Mendoza - Officer Johnny Cagle's Employee File (Revised)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Lake Jackson Texas Police - Arrest of Rolando Reyes by Officer Johnny Cagle and Officer Mendoza - Officer Johnny Cagle's Employee File (Revised)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Please provide any and all documents, files, photographs in the Civil Service File of: Officer Johnny Cagle.

2) If Lake Jackson Texas is NOT a Civil Service City then please provide any and all documents, files, photographs in the Employee File of: Officer Johnny  Cagle.

Excluded from this request:

a) Confidential information deemed protected by law, statute or Attorney General Ruling.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Stuart Martin

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: AIDS Healthcare Foundation Elevator at Madison Hotel (Los Angeles Department of Building and Safety)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents from ONLY January 1, 2023 to the present concerning the elevator at the Madison Hotel, located at 423 E. 7th Street, Los Angeles, CA 90014 (the "elevator"). Please note this ONLY asks for documents dated February 1, 2023 to the present, and ONLY about the elevator. This includes any of the following:
1. Applications for permits, and/or permits for any work or repairs on the elevator.
2. Orders to Comply
3. Inspection Reports
4. Emails or texts concerning the elevator to or from any of the following individuals: Robert Galardi (Housing Dept.), Tony Rosales (Housing Dept) , David Jennings (DBS), Darla Abel (DBS),  Jesse Leyva (DBS), Adam Burgess (DBS),  Brett Christensen (DBS), Ben Perez (DBS), Graciela Cota (DBS). 
5. Any complaints made by any member of the public about the elevator.
6. Photos or videos of the elevator
7. Incident reports about the elevator
8. Applications for plan checks and/or approvals/or notices of corrections needed about the elevator

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Annette Morasch

I also saw in the HCID records that the DBS inspector had taken photographs of the elevator.  For instance, this 2x4, or 4x4 underneath the carriage splintered. I'm sure the DBS inspectors would have noted this, and would have noted the bolt holding the wood together.

Please supplement the production. Thank you.

title: MO Dept of Public Safety Employment/Compensation Data

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: MO Dept of Public Safety Employment/Compensation Data

communications.communication: Please see the attached response.

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: MO Dept of Public Safety Employment/Compensation Data
communications.communication:
Hi Judy, 

After reviewing the statute, I understand that I requested information that is not open to the Sunshine request.  If allowed, I would like to revise my request to list only available documents with employee name, position, salary and hire date for fiscal years of both 2022 and 2023.  Also, I am requesting fees pleased be waived if at all possible. Or please notify me of any fees before fulfilling the request. 

Thank you.

I understand you wish to revise your request to now seek the following: employee name, position, salary and hire date for FY22 and FY23. The original estimate that the request will be processed in fifteen days continues to be the estimated length of time necessary to fulfill this updated request.  Thank you.

Attached is a spreadsheet containing those records sought in your records request. The below-provided definitions explains each employee class listed on the attached spreadsheet:
-           PUS = designates exception based paid employees. Exception based employees are those paid salary listed unless we tell the system changes are necessary. An example would be using a leave without pay code
-           HRLY = designates positive paid employees. These employees are paid hourly, and these hours must be entered into our system.

This fulfills and concludes this record request.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - AdventHealth
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, s. 286.011, F.S., I hereby request the following records:

All records related to AdventHealth also known as Adventist Health System from 2019 to 2023 (to the date of the day of processing) with respect to contracts and legal documents and within your agency's possession, the City of Altamonte Springs. More specifically, I request contracts and other legal documents that are in effect during the time frame specified.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I grant permission for fees up to $30. If the fees are still in excess of $30, please let me know as well as the number of results produced and I will further revise the criteria. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

communications.subject: PRR-2023-00443  RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - AdventHealth
communications.communication:
Good Morning,
We are in receipt of your public records request with the City of Altamonte Springs. Your request will be provided to the appropriate department that maintains this information. Please be advised that all requests are processed in the order in which they are received.
If the information is available electronically, and does not require extensive research time, there will be no charge. The City does charge $0.15 (single sided, up to 11” x 17”) per page for copies that are not available electronically. Actual cost of duplication will apply for copies larger than 11” x 17”. Also, if extensive research time is involved, an hourly fee will apply. You will be advised of all fees prior to beginning any work on this request.
If we need more information, a deposit to proceed with research, or once your request is complete, we will be in touch.

communications.subject: RE: PRR-2023-00443  RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - AdventHealth
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

In consideration of your request for “All records related to AdventHealth also known as Adventist Health System from 2019 to 2023 (to the date of the day of processing) with respect to contracts and legal documents and within your agency's possession, the City of Altamonte Springs. More specifically, I request contracts and other legal documents that are in effect during the time frame specified,” please be advised the link below will provide you with access to the current active contracts and purchase orders the City has with AdventHealth. Additionally, the link contains access to the readily available active legal documents the City has with AdventHealth.
Please be advised, access to this link will expire on Thursday, August 31, 2023 12:00 AM. It is suggested that you download and save the files contained in this link as once the link expires they will no longer be accessible and any requests for access to these files will be treated as a new request which will result in a further delay in obtaining your requested information.
https://ftp.altamonte.org/?ShareToken=B318F9DC2AF292BDD813D11D868E9C37F6EF1C2E


However, the remaining legal documents would require extensive research in order to provide. Therefore, as a follow-up to and regarding your Public Records Request, and with consideration of the extensive work required to provide you with the records you have requested, right now, City Staff has estimated it would take approximately 4 hours of staff time to provide you with each of the applicable documents/files that you have recently requested.  This suggested 4 hours is just a brief estimation of the time that right now, we anticipate it might take to provide the requested records.

Therefore, please find the attached the Invoice that would need to be paid, so we can provide you with these records. Please provide payment to:

City of Altamonte Springs
Office of the City Clerk
225 Newburyport Avenue
Altamonte Springs, FL 32701

Or, use the attached instructions to make your payment online. Please notify us once payment has been made. As soon as we receive your payment, Staff will continue working on your request.
Once payment has been provided, if we find that further time and monies are required to complete this work in its entirety, once the attached amount of payment has been exhausted, we will be back in touch to see how you would like us to continue; and likewise, if we can do the work for less time than the estimated timeframe, we will of course provide you with a refund.
Thank you for your consideration and should you have any further questions, please feel free to contact us.

Good Afternoon,

Thank you for your patience and consideration as we worked on your request.

Regarding your request, the below link will provide you with access to the records that City Staff has provided.
Please be advised, access to this link will expire on Wednesday, October 11, 2023 12:00 AM. It is suggested that you download and save the files contained in this link as once the link expires they will no longer be accessible and any requests for access to these files will be treated as a new request which will result in a further delay in obtaining your requested information.
https://ftp.altamonte.org/?ShareToken=C4C8898274F3B5976C05F5BCC84E287F214F057F

In supplying this information, we will consider this matter complete, however should you have any questions in regards to this request, please let us know.


PLEASE CLICK REPLY ALL WHEN RESPONDING OR SEND NEW INQUIRIES TO CITYCLERK@ALTAMONTE.ORG<mailto:CITYCLERK@ALTAMONTE.ORG>.



Thank you,


ALISA PRINCE, CMC, FCRM

title: Ayer Gage Cannabis Correspondence (Ayer Police Department)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Ayer Gage Cannabis Correspondence (Ayer Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide any municipal and/or Ayer law enforcement communications—internal, external, email, or otherwise—that mention "Gage", "Gage Cannabis", and/or any kind of correspondence related to an "I love the 90's" planned for Red Tail Golf Club at 15 Bulge Road, Devens on Friday, September 22, 2023. Please search back to June 1, 2023.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Faraone

We have researched our files and have attached the items that fit your request.

Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N014147-090423
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

09/05/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR151572 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014147-090423 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(  ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
( ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Annie Righi 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N014147-090423
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
October 4, 2023 Miriam Bhimani 151572-21668578@requests.muckrock.com 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014147-090423 
Dear Ms. Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Supply the Investigative Memoranda with the following File Numbers: 

Investigative Memorandum #7815 
Investigative Memorandum #7816 
Investigative Memorandum #7817 
Investigative Memorandum #7818 
Investigative Memorandum #7819 
Investigative Memorandum #7820 
Investigative Memorandum #7821 
Investigative Memorandum #7822 
Investigative Memorandum #7823 
Investigative Memorandum #7824 RESPONSE : Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from public disclosure; those portions have been redacted including date of birth, employee identification numbers, personal phone numbers, home addresses, and other highly personal information. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. Certain redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) and the corresponding 105 ILCS 5/34-18.5(b) which prohibits the release of background check information. Personally identifiable student record information has been redacted in accordance with the Illinois School Student Records Act 105 ILCS 10/1 et seq. and the corresponding Section 7.5(r) FOIA exemption (5 ILCS 140/7.5(r)). Furthermore, redactions have been applied pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) which exempts from release “[i]nformation specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law” and the corresponding s ection 11 of the Abused and Neglected Child Reporting Act which provides that “[a]ll records concerning reports of child abuse and neglect or records concerning referrals under this Act and all records generated as a result of such reports or referrals, shall be confidential and shall not be disclosed except as specifically authorized by this Act or other applicable law.” 325 ILCS 5/11. To the extent you consider this a denial, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706.  You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11. If you have any questions, please contact our office at (773) 553-3500. Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Annie Righi Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Mark Keith Robinson service records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All military service records for Mark Keith Robinson, DOB:  August 18, 1968, including but not limited to discharge paperwork, training logs, and service awards.

I would ask that all documents be released on a rolling basis as they become available. 

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. 

Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Albert Serna Jr.

communications.subject: Fwd: Freedom of Information Act Request: Mark Keith Robinson service records
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Serna:

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to
the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) via email to
foia@nara.gov. We received your request on September 28, 2023.  Your
request states:

*Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
records: All military service records for Mark Keith Robinson, DOB: August
18, 1968, including but not limited to discharge paperwork, training logs,
and service awards.*

Due to the nature of your inquiry, we are forwarding your request by this
email to the National Personnel Records Center (NPRC) for Military Records
in St. Louis for appropriate handling.  The NPRC will assign your request a
tracking number and respond directly to you.  In the future, if you need to
contact the NPRC, you can do so by mail or fax to the following address:

National Personnel Records Center
1 Archives Drive
St. Louis, Missouri 63138

Telephone:   314-801-0800
Telephone (Toll Free):  1-866-272-6272 (only within the US)
Fax:  314-801-9195

For your reference, below you will find your original submission.

On our website at https://www.archives.gov/veterans/military-service-records
you can find information about requesting Official Military Personnel Files
(OMPFs) that are not yet archival records fully open to the public.  At the
website for the National Archives at St. Louis,
https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/ <https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/%20>,
you will find information about requesting Official Military Personnel
Files that are now archival records open to the public.  The OMPF normally
becomes an archival record 62 years after the date of discharge.

At www.archives.gov/foia <http://www.archives.gov/foia%20> we provide
information about FOIA.  On our home page, www.archives.gov, you can learn
about the resources that we offer to the public, and access our online
catalog.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and pursuant to guidance received from the
Office of Management and Budget (OMB), NARA had adjusted its normal
operations to balance the need of completing its mission-critical work
while also adhering to the recommended social distancing for the safety of
our staff.  NPRC is working with a reduced on site staff who are
prioritizing veterans' burial requests, homeless veterans, and medical
emergency requests.  As a result of this re-prioritization of activities,
you may experience a delay in receiving a substantive response to your FOIA
request.  We apologize for this inconvenience and appreciate your
understanding and patience.

Sincerely,
Ashley Bryan
Government Information Specialist
Office of General Counsel (NGC)
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road
College Park, Maryland, 20740-6001
301-837-3642

Best,

Albert Serna

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request: Mark Keith Robinson service records
communications.communication:
Mr. Serna,

The National Archives holds Federal military service records from the
Revolutionary War to 1912 in the National Archives in Washington, D.C.
Military service records from WWI - present are held in the National
Military Personnel Records Center (NPRC), in St. Louis, Missouri. See
details of holdings.

Sincerely,

Ashley Bryan
Government Information Specialist
Office of General Counsel (NGC)
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road
College Park, Maryland, 20740-6001
301-837-3642

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Mark Keith Robinson service records
communications.communication:

I will submit the rest of my requests to NPRC. 

Best,

Albert Serna Jr.

communications.subject: How to Submit for Military Records
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the National Personnel Records Center. If you 
would like to submit a request, you may do so online at 
http://vetrecs.archives.gov, and select the blue “Start Request Online” 
button. We cannot provide an estimated completion date at this time. 

Alternatively, you can complete a Standard form 180 using the link below. 
https://www.archives.gov/files/research/order/standard-form-180.pdf  

FAX to (314) 801-9195 or mail it to our Center at:

National Personnel Records Center

Military Personnel Records

1 Archives Drive

Saint Louis, MO 63138 
Please do not reply to this email. Please call (314) 801-0800 if you have 
any questions.

Thank you,
KC

title: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman  Vehicle Accidents Sheriff

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman  Vehicle Accidents Sheriff
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any accidents involving any county vehicle that the Sheriff, Parnell McNamara, was driving in the last three years. this includes even the most minor or one car accidents, one car accident, or any other accident, see legal term "accident". Thank you

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI files: Daniel Ellsberg
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request an electronic copy of all FBI files on Daniel Ellsberg, the military analyst who leaked the Pentagon Papers. He died in June 2023. Here is his obituary: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/06/16/us/daniel-ellsberg-dead.html

I request that your agency conduct a full CRS search, as well as a cross reference search, to retrieve records related to this prominent American.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: FW: [Non-DoD Source] RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #DON-NAVY-2020-007167
communications.communication:
Good morning:

First, my apologies for the delayed response.

title: Pride Month 2017, 2018, 2019 (National Archives and Records Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Pride Month 2017, 2018, 2019 (National Archives and Records Administration)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of records mentioning or describing Pride Month activities, events or observances in 2017, 2018 or 2019. This includes, but is not limited to:

* directives
* policies
* pride flag
* commemoration
* publications
* emails, memos, letters, and other communications with OGAs or the White House

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Open Records Request: Fusus Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

It was reported on September 4th that the Dayton Police Department is participating in a program granted the Department access to Fusus through the Ohio Attorney General's Office: https://www.daytondailynews.com/local/dayton-area-police-will-continue-testing-live-video-feeds-from-privately-owned-cameras/YDJH7GHL6JBAZGHOMTI7EZYDWQ/

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, grant documents, and other agreement documents with the Ohio Attorney General's Office for access to Fusus. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails and Records related to complaints or grievances from District Support Service Center staff about mistreatment, harassment, misconduct by supervisors, leads, disagreements about job requirements. Include any HR emails or records, any Director emails, Supervisor emails related to this subject. From 2016 to 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rex Anthony Sites

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Dec. 9, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

On behalf of the district's Public Records Officer Simone Neal, and pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this email acknowledges receipt of the public records request you submitted to the Mukilteo School District on December 8, 2022.  Specifically, you requested:

"Emails and Records related to complaints or grievances from District Support Service Center staff about mistreatment, harassment, misconduct by supervisors, leads, disagreements about job requirements. Include any HR emails or records, any Director emails, Supervisor emails related to this subject. From 2016 to 2022."

The district is processing your request.  The district anticipates that the first installment of records responsive to your request will be available no later than March 1, 2023.  This additional time is necessary, per RCW 42.56.520, to locate and assemble the information requested, to determine whether any of the information you requested is exempt from public disclosure and produce a corresponding exemption log, and to notify any third party affected by the request.  As documents responsive to your request are ready for disclosure, they will be provided to you.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney
Director of Human Resources
Mukilteo School District
9401 Sharon Drive
Everett, Washington 98204
425-356-1298
barneykd@mukilteo.wednet.edu<mailto:barneykd@mukilteo.wednet.edu>
Pronouns: he/him/his

Employment Opportunities - https://www.mukilteoschools.org/Page/937

[Image]

The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material, the disclosure of which is governed by applicable law. Any review, retransmission, dissemination or other use of, or taking of any action in reliance upon, this information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient is prohibited. If you received this in error, please contact the sender and destroy the materials contained in this message.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm following up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Dec. 9, 2022. You previously indicated that it would be completed on March 1, 2023. I wanted to let you know that I am still interested in the following documents, and to see if that date was still accurate.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

I sent an email to you on 2/13/23, requesting clarification on your request.  I have copied that email below for your convenience, as you have not yet responded to it:

Dear Mr. Sites,

In my December 16, 2022, email to you in response to your December 8, 2022 request for records, I estimated the first installment of those records would be available to you by March 1, 2023.  Specifically, you requested “Emails and Records related to complaints or grievances from District Support Service Center staff about mistreatment, harassment, misconduct by supervisors, leads, disagreements about job requirements. Include any HR emails or records, any Director emails, Supervisor emails related to this subject. From 2016 to 2022”.

As you know, the District Support Services Center includes hundreds of staff across multiple job classifications in the Transportation, Custodial, Maintenance, Grounds, Publications, and Nutrition Services departments.  Searching for emails relating to this many staff members over six years to find potentially responsive records will take a significant amount of time.  Therefore, we invite you to narrow your request.  Are there specific complaints or individuals for whom you are looking for records?

If you would like to proceed with your request as written, please let me know and I will update the expected timeline for processing the request.  I look forward to receiving a reply from you about how you would like to proceed with your request.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Barney,

To narrow the search criteria please search for only Maintenance and Ground staff complaints towards Cisco.  From date Cisco was hired. Adhere to the rest of my original request.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
Thank you for the clarification.  Are there specific staff who may have reported complaints that you would like us to search for?  Without specific names, we will need to search the email for every Maintenance and Grounds staff member employed during the period you requested to identify any that may contain terms relating to your request.

We can certainly do this, but if there are specific records you are looking for we will be able to provide them more quickly if we narrow the staff members involved.  Please let me know your preference.
- Kirk

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

As we continue to review records that may be responsive to your request, I would like to clarify one more item with you.  As I read your revised request below for “Maintenance and Ground staff complaints towards Cisco. From date Cisco was hired.”, this request is already included in your 12/8/22 request for “Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022.”

Given this overlap, can we consider your second request, originally estimated to have a first installment on 3/1/23, to be withdrawn as we continue to process the first request listed above?  We want to be as efficient as possible in providing you with the records you have requested.
- Kirk

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
Hello Kirk,
Sorry to get back to you so late. I am having issues with locating the responses through MuckRock. Probably my fault.
 In your last email you stated that there are 23,300 correspondences that pertain to Cisco. I replied back to limit it to District Support and Grounds staff. What I got so far is nowhere near what I expected. Out of those 23,300 emails I get maybe 5 or six?
So far I received maybe 4 cases from different staff. I am hoping that there are more coming.
I am amazed that there is nothing that pertains to the last meetings we had with you , John, David and myself. Is this going to be disclosed? Am I not getting ALL the information I asked for?
What I got so far:
Jeff True: being asked about kneepads. 
Dave Bailey: emailing Keith about something that has to do with no communications.
David Nwonty (misspelled): Emailing Keith about no communications.
Rex Sites: emails from Karen about my exit statement. Seems to be missing some of the email threads though.

I will wait for ALL information to come in a timely matter. 
I wish you well.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
Kirk,
I forgot to add that I want to see ALL emails between Cisco and Kevin Freitas during that time period.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
Hello Mr. Sites,

We have begun the search for the records you requested with an email search.  Of course, all records relevant to your request will be provided.  The way in which your request is worded requires us to review thousands of individual emails to determine whether or not they are responsive.  That is the reason I had invited you to narrow your request if there were specific details you were looking for that would allow us to conduct the search more quickly.

If you would like to revise your request, please let me know.
- Kirk

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

On behalf of the district's Public Records Officer Simone Neal, and pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this email acknowledges receipt of the public records request you submitted to the Mukilteo School District on April 4, 2023. Specifically, you requested:

"I forgot to add that I want to see ALL emails between Cisco and Kevin Freitas during that time period.”  The District is interpreting the time period to be 1/1/16 to 12/31/22 based on the previous request you appear to be referencing.  Please let me know if that is not accurate.

The district is processing your request. The district anticipates that the first installment of records responsive to your request will be available no later than September 1, 2023. This additional time is necessary, per RCW 42.56.520, to locate and assemble the information requested, to determine whether any of the information you requested is exempt from public disclosure and produce a corresponding exemption log, and to notify any third party affected by the request. As documents responsive to your request are ready for disclosure, they will be provided to you.

Sincerely,
Kirk Barney

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
Hello Kirk,

I am going to need the information as I requested in email sent to you on 4-4-2023.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm following up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Dec. 9, 2022. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Sept. 1, 2023. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mukilteo School District HR Department
communications.communication:
Hello,

The staff member who will be responding to your request is currently out of the office so there will be a slight delay in answering your question.  She will provide you with an update when she returns on Tuesday.  Have a good weekend.
- Kirk

communications.subject: Response to Public Records Request - April 4, 2023
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

With regard to your records request received by the district on April 4, 2023 (as noted below), the district is adjusting the timeline for sending you a first installment. We anticipate a first installment will be sent to you no later than September 29, 2023.

Sincerely,

Tammy Bengen, Executive Assistant for
Assistant Superintendent Equity, Engagement & Academics and
Assistant Superintendent Business, Human Resources & Technology
9401 Sharon Dr. | Everett, WA 98204
bengentl@mukilteo.wednet.edu<mailto:bengentl@mukilteo.wednet.edu>

communications.subject: Response to Request for Public Records
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern,

Per the Public Records Act, you are entitled to a copy of the third party notification with regard to your request (noted below my signature) for public records. A copy of the notification is attached.

The District apologizes that an installment of records was not sent to you by September 1, 2023. Last spring, our district went through a reduction in force which eliminated one of our employees who assisted in processing records. Remaining staff are diligently trying to keep pace with ongoing requests. Thank you for your understanding as we work through this change in our system. The District anticipates an installment of records will be sent to you no later than October 4, 2023.

Sincerely,

Tammy Bengen, Executive Assistant for
Assistant Superintendent Equity, Engagement & Academics and
Assistant Superintendent Business, Human Resources & Technology
9401 Sharon Dr. | Everett, WA 98204
bengentl@mukilteo.wednet.edu<mailto:bengentl@mukilteo.wednet.edu>

communications.subject: Installment 1 Response to Public Records Request - April 4, 2023
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

In response to your request, the district is providing you with a first installment of records.
They include approximately 6,055 pages of emails sent by Kevin Freitas to Cisco Gomez, dated 2017 through 2022.

The files are too large to send through the district email system. I have placed them in a shared Google folder at this link<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1sQ69LVldBg5zJLcTducEJ73ZPZurakdA?usp=drive_link>. You may access, view and download the records. Be sure to save them for your use.

Let me know if you have any questions about the records.

communications.subject: Final Installment Response to Public Records Request - April 4, 2023
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

In response to your request, the district is providing you with a final installment of records.
They include approximately 5,383 pages of emails sent by Cisco Gomez to Kevin Freitas dated 2017 through 2022, along with an exemption log.

Please note, in your original request you asked for emails dating back to 2015. The district did not locate any email records for the years 2015 or 2016.

The files are too large to send through the district email system. I have placed them in a shared Google folder at this link<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PG3SXovIyg7A-475Ea6JzYdzjISNrxzv?usp=drive_link>. You may access, view and download the records. Be sure to save them for your use. The file will remain accessible for 30 days.

Let me know if you have any questions about the records.

With this response, the district considers this request closed.

Sincerely,

Tammy Bengen, Executive Assistant for
Assistant Superintendent Equity, Engagement & Academics and
Assistant Superintendent Business, Human Resources & Technology
9401 Sharon Dr. | Everett, WA 98204

communications.subject: Final Response to Request for Records December 9, 2022
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

In response to your request for records dated December 9, 2022 related to complaints or grievances from District Support Service Center staff (amended to grounds and maintenance staff) about mistreatment, harassment, misconduct by supervisors, leads, disagreements about job requirements; including any human resources emails or records, any director emails, supervisor emails related to this subject from 2016 to 2022, the district is providing you with numerous responsive records (approximately 2300 pages) in the form of notes and emails. An exemption log accompanies the records.

The files are too large to send through the district's email system. I have created a shared folder at this link<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1wGXqj7enuup-BlaZR4u4CYxu3x6Gzx6Y?usp=sharing>. You may access, review and download the documents. Besides the email I am using to respond to your request, I have shared the folder with the email address sitesra47@gmail.com<mailto:sitesra47@gmail.com>. Please be sure to save copies of the records for your use. The folder will remain active for 30 days or through November 3, 2023.

If you have any questions about the records, please let me know.

Sincerely,

Tammy Bengen, Executive Assistant for

9401 Sharon Dr. | Everett, WA 98204

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: J. Chou email logs
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to Illinois Freedom of Information act, I request the following:

A log of all emails sent to or from Jadine Chou, CPS Chief of Safety and Security, between January 2, 2021 to January 1, 2023, and for which "nasro" or "NASRO" appears in the subject line, attachment file name, or email body/text, or which appears in the domain of an email recipient or sender (e.g., <name>@nasro.org). Please also include emails for which Jadine Chou is copied (cc or bcc) for this time span.

I am not requesting the emails themselves; this is a request for email metadata, including senders, recipients, date and time, subject line, and any attachments.

This is a non-commercial request. If there are fees, please inform me of the total charges in advance. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit Lucy Parsons Labs, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ICLS 140/6(c).

I prefer for the responsive records to be sent electronically. Please feel free to contact me with any questions or if clarification is needed.
Thank you for your assistance.

Lucy Parsons Labs

communications.subject: FOIA Request :: N014223-091823
communications.communication:
Dear Lucy: 
 
Thank you for your interest in Chicago Public Schools. Your FOIA request has been received and is being processed. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: N014223-091823 
You have requested the following records: Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to Illinois Freedom of Information act, I request the following:

A log of all emails sent to or from Jadine Chou, CPS Chief of Safety and Security, between January 2, 2021 to January 1, 2023, and for which "nasro" or "NASRO" appears in the subject line, attachment file name, or email body/text, or which appears in the domain of an email recipient or sender (e.g., @nasro.org). Please also include emails for which Jadine Chou is copied (cc or bcc) for this time span.

I am not requesting the emails themselves; this is a request for email metadata, including senders, recipients, date and time, subject line, and any attachments.

This is a non-commercial request. If there are fees, please inform me of the total charges in advance. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit Lucy Parsons Labs, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ICLS 140/6(c).

I prefer for the responsive records to be sent electronically. Please feel free to contact me with any questions or if clarification is needed.
Thank you for your assistance.

Lucy Parsons Labs

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fj-chou-email-logs-152126%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ1CCn_QB9jem9PQylx6L91s%3A1qiPmk%3Aqh1o7rw5wjkhMBtnxBFUpaopwx3IhD1A23hthNrE4pA 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N014223-091823
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

09/19/2023 

Lucy Parsons Labs 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR152126 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Lucy: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014223-091823 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(  ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
( ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Annie Righi 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N014223-091823
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
October 3, 2023 Lucy Parsons Labs 152126-75955326@requests.muckrock.com 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014223-091823 
Dear Requester: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: Pursuant to Illinois Freedom of Information act, I request the following: 

A log of all emails sent to or from Jadine Chou, CPS Chief of Safety and Security, between January 2, 2021 to January 1, 2023, and for which "nasro" or "NASRO" appears in the subject line, attachment file name, or email body/text, or which appears in the domain of an email recipient or sender (e.g., @ nasro.org ). Please also include emails for which Jadine Chou is copied (cc or bcc) for this time span. RESPONSE : Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Personal email addresses have been redacted pursuant to section 7(1)(c) of the FOIA which exempts from release “[p]ersonal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy.” 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c). To the extent you consider this a denial, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706.  You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11. If you have any questions, please contact our office at (773) 553-3500. Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Annie Righi Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: James Collier Investigation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The full and complete investigative case file into Everett Police Department James Collier regarding the tweets listed in this article
https://www.heraldnet.com/news/police-union-leader-accused-of-anti-protest-twitter-trolling/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bridget Brululo

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request: Carabin & COVID
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Metadata of all emails which are sent to, from, including being CCed or BCCed by David Carabin from January 1, 2020 to April 19, 2023 including one of the following keywords, "COVID Relief", "COVID Grant" or "COVID Funds".

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and if the email has an attachment. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please provide me with the records in an Excel format.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: UPDATE
communications.communication:
Good morning, 
  
 I am touching base just to give you an update on your request. As on December we went over to a new system with open records request so I no longer have access to our old system to get the request you are acquiring about. I have spoken with my Chief who states we should have two years of old requests backed up for insistences like this. Chief Kibodeaux emailed our old system on 7/12/2023 to get these files. We should be hearing back from them by Monday of next week (7/17/2023). I will email you with updates as I receive them. 
  
 Thank you for your patience, 
  
 Caitlin Stark

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Shotspotter communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) All emails exchanges–including incoming messages, outgoing messages, forwards, and attachments–between the department's chief/commissioner and ShotSpotter representatives since January 1, 2021. ShotSpotter representatives can be identified by searching the department's email system for addresses ending in "@shotspotter.com."  

2) All emails exchanges–including incoming messages, outgoing messages, forwards, and attachments–between the department's public information and/or media relations staff members and ShotSpotter representatives since January 1, 2021. ShotSpotter representatives can be identified by searching the department's email system for addresses ending in "@shotspotter.com."  

Please note that it is illegal to ignore this request because it was not submitted via a website portal.

I ask that all fees be waived as I intend to use the requested records to further public understanding of government functions and not for any commercial purpose.

In the event that you choose to withhold or redact the records, I ask that you provide a detailed explanation of the statutory and/or case law upon which each rejection or redaction is based.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Todd Feathers

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fboston-police-department-174%252Fshotspotter-communications-128887%252F%253Femail%253Dshawn.williams%252540boston.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj3akswzqXV9UicURLv4wh7to%3A1nqRni%3AjwETPHSvgYV636AobWAY3Q7NoJ_fm4rsgFZjlGjsTDY Your request does not comply with the Massachusetts public records law and its access regulations, as it is overly broad and vague.  A public records request must reasonably describe the records sought. G. L. c. 66, § 10(a)(i). 

In a recent Suffolk Superior Court case, the court found that “[t]he reasonable description requirement contemplates that a requesting party will identify documents or categories of documents with sufficient particularity that government employees will be able to understand exactly what they are looking for, and then make a prompt production.” Chawla v. Dep't of Revenue, Suffolk. Sup. No. 1784CV02087, at 2 (January 23, 2019). 

The court further found “[r]equests for documents that are articulated with very broad language that calls upon non-lawyer administrative personnel to interpret the scope of what is sought, and then make fine judgments about what documents are and are not sufficiently ‘related’ to the category of materials requested, will not satisfy this statutory standard.” Id. ( emphasis in original). 

In accordance with G. L. c. 66, § 10(a)(i) and the Chawla decision, it is unclear with “sufficient particularity” which records you seek. Thus, your request “calls upon non-lawyer administrative personnel to interpret the scope of what is sought, and then make fine judgments about what documents are and are not sufficiently ‘[regarding]’ the category of materials requested.” Chawla, at 2. Should you seek specific records I encourage you to visit the City's public records portal. https://bostonma.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/(S(4ihmrhaxyjn0l4fkagn2d4jn))/supporthome.aspx Very truly yours, Shawn A. Williams, Esq. Director of Public Records Records Access Officer

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request #B001285-051522
communications.communication:
To Whom it May Concern,

I'm writing to appeal the Boston Police Department's denial of my request for emails between specific department employees and employees of the company ShotSpotter (now Sound Thinking).

In his rejection letter, Mr. Williams of the BPD misleadingly cites a superior court order and claims that I have not described the records I'm seeking with "sufficient particularity" and that my request would require non-lawyers to make "fine judgements" about what documents do and don't fall within the scope of the request.

This argument — the first communication I've had from BPD about this request for a year — is absurd.

To begin with, employees of the BPD do not need to make any judgements about what documents satisfy my requests. I clearly defined the time parameters, types of documents, and senders and recipients of the relevant emails and provided a simple way for the department to identify responsive records — by searching its email system for messages to/from @shotspotter.com addresses.

Strangely, Mr. Williams claims that his rejection is supported by a Suffolk Superior Court's finding in a recent case. That is incorrect. The document Mr. William cites from Chawla v. Mass. Department of Revenue is a non-decisional order that. In fact, in the very first paragraph of the document, Judge Gordon wrote: "The Court is not prepared to render a formal disposition of this case today, because the record is not in the state it would need to be in to make such a ruling."

If Mr. Williams had read further, he would also have seen that the Chawla case stemmed from a broad request for records "pertaining to" a particular program and that Judge Gordon ultimately instructed the Department of Revenue to continue producing responsive documents. Luckily for BPD, my request is nothing like the one in the Chawla case.  It specifically identifies the emails I am seeking by timeframe, recipient, and sender.

It's also worth noting that if Mr. Williams had any questions about which records are or aren't responsive to my request he could have asked me at any time over the past year. As Judge Gordon wrote, "The parties would obviously have been better served had they engaged in a dialogue at the outset..."

For the reasons stated above, I ask that the Supervisor of Records instruct BPD to provide the responsive records in a timely manner.

Sincerely,
Todd Feathers

06/20/2023 RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of May 15, 2022, Reference # B001285-051522 Dear Todd Feathers: The City of Boston (City) has received your request for public records.  This response applies only to records that exist and are in the custody of the City. See A Guide to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, p. 32, n.115.  It is expected that a custodian of records must use her superior knowledge of her records with respect to responses to public records requests.  950 CMR 32.04(5).  Specifically, you stated: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records: 

1) All emails exchanges–including incoming messages, outgoing messages, forwards, and attachments–between the department's chief/commissioner and ShotSpotter representatives since January 1, 2021. ShotSpotter representatives can be identified by searching the department's email system for addresses ending in "@shotspotter.com." 

2) All emails exchanges–including incoming messages, outgoing messages, forwards, and attachments–between the department's public information and/or media relations staff members and ShotSpotter representatives since January 1, 2021. ShotSpotter representatives can be identified by searching the department's email system for addresses ending in "@shotspotter.com." 

Please note that it is illegal to ignore this request because it was not submitted via a website portal. 

I ask that all fees be waived as I intend to use the requested records to further public understanding of government functions and not for any commercial purpose. 

In the event that you choose to withhold or redact the records, I ask that you provide a detailed explanation of the statutory and/or case law upon which each rejection or redaction is based. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage. 

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Todd Feathers
